results.title: Show me English: the job interview [episode 7]
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. Shows Tina how to apply for a job and the background information that is required from the applicant.Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: the local council [episode 6]
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. A problem tree growing outside Tina’s home necessitates the involvement of the local council in reaching a satisfactory solution. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: a visit to the doctor [episode 5]
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants communicate in everyday situations. On the second visit to the doctor, Tina is given the result of her test and is prescribed medication and given advice on the importance of diet and rest. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Show me English: a visit to hospital [episode 4]
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A series of programmes which aim to help adult migrants to communicate in everyday situations. The receptionist at a large hospital gives directions to Tina on how to find the Pathology Department. Home tutor program by the Adult Migrant Information Service.

results.title: Accounting equation. Parts 1-4
results.creator_credit: Niels Ellmoos, Bill Renwick and Interaction Media
results.brief_description: A four part instructional series following a ‘real-life’ business entity in Newcastle, Australia, through one month’s trading, to the presentation of financial statements.

results.title: Extinction is forever!
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Kerry Aulsbrook, an Education Officer specializing in natural history at the Museum of Victoria introduces Australian customs regulations prohibiting imports of animals and natural products. Examines the threats faced by species now close to extinction because of human interference.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Get wet again
results.brief_description: More fun with Jonathan Coleman. In this program his nervous “brother” Terry learns to swim - with the assistance of Lisa Forrest. The emphasis is on feeling at ease in the water and includes activities such as blowing bubbles, floating, basic swimming and rescue.
